results.title: In the Company of Wes Anderson
results.abstract: What is it about the director that draws stars like Frances McDormand and Tilda Swinton again and again? There are many reasons, but the nightly feasts don’t hurt.

results.title: ‘Dune’ Review: A Hero in the Making, on Shifting Sands
results.abstract: Denis Villeneuve’s adaptation is an equally sweeping and intimate take on Frank Herbert’s future-shock epic.

multimedia.caption: Timothée Chalamet as Paul Atreides and Rebecca Ferguson as Lady Jessica in “Dune.” Paul is considerably less complicated and conflicted onscreen than he is on the page, our critic writes.

results.abstract: Ridley Scott and his all-star cast rip the moldy fig leaf off chivalric romance in a he-said, he-said, she-said spectacle.

results.title: Selma Blair Wants You to See Her Living With Multiple Sclerosis
results.abstract: The actress puts herself out there in “Introducing, Selma Blair,” an unflinching documentary that she hopes can help others.

results.title: Visconti’s Operatic Autopsy of German History, Restored Anew
results.abstract: The trilogy of “The Damned,” “Death in Venice” and “Ludwig” is whole again, in editions that freshly reveal their conflicted queerness.

multimedia.caption: Helmut Berger as King Ludwig II of Bavaria in Luchino Visconti’s “Ludwig,” the sprawling third installment of his so-called German trilogy.

results.abstract: The French actress has roles in “No Time to Die,” “The French Dispatch” and the upcoming “France.” She sees acting as a way to connect to the world.

results.title: Alan Horn, a top creative executive, is the latest high-ranking Disney departure.

results.title: Rambo, Romeo, Rome: His Posters Capture Films’ Essential Moments
results.abstract: Renato Casaro’s hand-drawn art has hooked movie audiences around the world since the 1950s. Tarantino and Stallone are big fans. One secret to his success? “You can’t cheat.”

results.title: Alec Baldwin Fatally Shoots Crew Member With Prop Firearm, Authorities Say
results.abstract: The movie’s director of photography was killed and the director was injured on the set of “Rust,” a Western, a sheriff’s office in New Mexico said.
results.byline: By Alyssa Lukpat and Michael Levenson

results.title: Diane Weyermann, Executive Who Championed ‘An Inconvenient Truth,’ Dies at 66
results.abstract: A former public interest lawyer, she oversaw this and many other documentaries that addressed urgent social issues.

multimedia.caption: The movie executive Diane Weyermann, known for her socially conscious documentaries, at the Sundance Film Festival in 2007. “It is not an exaggeration,” former Vice President Al Gore said, “to say she really did change the world.”

results.title: ‘Becoming Cousteau’ Review: The Old Man and the Sea
results.abstract: Liz Garbus’s new documentary is about the life of the French explorer Jacques-Yves Cousteau and the fate of the oceans he loved.

results.title: Leslie Bricusse, Prolific Songwriter for Stage and Screen, Dies at 90

results.title: AMC to Add Onscreen Captions at Some Locations
results.abstract: The move was lauded by advocates for the deaf and the hard of hearing, but theater owners worry audiences don’t want captions.

results.title: Capturing the Magic of Movies
results.abstract: The long-awaited Academy Museum of Motion Pictures recognizes many of those who worked behind the scenes and comes to terms with Hollywood’s past.
